Amy Hung, expressive arts therapist and drama educator, will join Annie in the post-show sharing session to discuss the concepts and messages behind the performance.As a Mental Health Ambassador at Mind HK, Annie shares her mental health recovery journey with the community. Join us in watching her performance, and let‚Äôs talk about mental health to normalise and destigmatise it!This event is organised by Mind HK‚Äôs More Than a Label anti-stigma campaign. about: What the cello says ÊèêÁê¥Ë™™Come join us at Sky Music Studio for an evening filled with the enchanting sounds of the cello, where we explore the intricate and fascinating relationship between music and mental health! This event is sure to take you on a journey lead by our talented musicians that captivates you ears and soul, and leaves you feeling inspired and moved. name: The Gift of Stage Presence: Back and better than ever!
location: Stage Ground, Benon Tower 10/F, 266 Des Voeux Road West Sai Ying Pun, HKI
about: Hey there! Are you a fan of improv? Do you wish to become a more confident performer? Well, I‚Äôm glad you‚Äôre here!Join me, Sarah, one of the funny friends over at Rooftop Improv for a workshop all about stage presence and performing with confidence. Round one was so successful, I just HAD to come back for more!In this workshop, we will explore improv through an actor lens, break down the details of certain moments in a scene, and really get into how to hop on stage and rock a scene under pressure.Oh, you've been here before? GREAT! Come back. :) Improv is always new and different, and I know you more now as a performer, so I know how you can level up! Whether it's your first workshop or you've been before and can't get enough, I'm happy to have you.ABOUT THE HOSTSarah Wun is an educator, writer, filmmaker, dancer, puppeteer, improviser, and award-winning actress. She has taught all kinds of theatre, choreographed dance and stage combat for school plays, and directed a school play turned film during Covid in early 2020. She‚Äôs a legend when it comes to adaptation and thinking on the spot. Her acting stage credits include The Picture of Dorian Gray (2025), Time Flies (2024), and Robinhood the Panto (2023).Sarah has written three screenplays: Best Smile in the World (2022), Forward (2023) - featuring a familiar face from Rooftop!, and Remnants (2024). She has also acted in several short films, and two feature films. Sarah is currently cowriting a dark comedy TV show about growing up with a facial difference.Sarah has been a part of Rooftop Improv for four years. In that time, Rooftop has taken part in an international festival, done several workshops, and hosted loads of performances in Hong Kong.Sarah currently works as a principal artist at Treasure Chest Theatre and is constantly using her improv skills, whether it‚Äôs as a puppet or teaching dance. She teaches another form of stage presence at her Burlesque classes where she focuses on promoting self confidence through body awareness and rhythm. When she‚Äôs not performing or teaching or writing, she can be found spinning upside down on an aerial hoop or silk. Essentially, Sarah is ALWAYS performing.Sarah has taught improv to children and adults in school settings, and led team building activities in work environments. Sarah is eager - once again!!! - to bring her various performance skills AND feedback from previous participants (thank you) to this workshop!

name: Triple Headliner Comedy Night: Vivek Mahbubani, Vanessa Wang, & Harsh Jha
location: The Aftermath, 57-59 Wyndham Street Hong Kong, HKI
about: Vivek Mahbubani is a Hong Kong-bred bilingual stand-up comedian performing in both Cantonese and English. Having been crowned the Funniest Person (in Chinese) in Hong Kong in 2007 followed by his victory in the English category at the Hong Kong International Comedy Competition in 2008, Vivek has had the opportunity to take his sense of humor all over the world including Hong Kong, China, Macau, Singapore, Malaysia, Philippines, Thailand, Sri Lanka, India, Australia, Canada and USA.In 2014, the World Famous Laugh Factory in USA ranked Vivek as one of the top 10 comedians in their Annual Funniest Person in thean World Competition.In 2015, he was handpicked as one of the comedians to represent Asia‚Äôs best in Melbourne International Comedy Festival‚Äôs inaugural ‚ÄúComedy Zone Asia‚Äù shows.In 2016, he was featured in Comedy Central‚Äôs first ever ‚ÄúStand up Asia!‚Äù shows. One of Vivek‚Äôs passions is reading and his favorite book is Sun Tzu‚Äôs Art of War. Oddly, his favorite color is hot pink.At 42 Harsh is the newest old comedian in Hong Kong. After years of trying to be funny he recently admitted people would only laugh At him. Instantly turning him into a comedian worthy of sharing the stage with HK's best comics and even international star Paul Ogata.Vanessa Wong is an actress, living in a rom-com... but lacking the romantic part. Her picks in food are as suspicious as her picks in men.

name: Introduction to Improv Course (101) - Fall Term
location: Fringe Club, 2 Lower Albert Road Underground Theatre Hong Kong, HKI
about: OverviewWatched improv comedy and thought "I'd like to give that a try"? An actor looking to train up on ever popular improv skills? Needing help with public speaking skills? Just wanting to be comfortable not knowing what'll happen next?Whoever you are, whatever your background, if you're wanting to learn the skills of improv from the start and to be left with a solid grounding in improv, then this is the course for you.Over 8-weeks, discover - through the supportive, collaborative process we call improv performance - how to create stories, characters and ideas to captivate an audience right before their eyes. Develop those public speaking skills to allow easier and more natural dialogs with your audience. Learn how to relish the opportunity to embrace the unexpected!Topics covered by this workshopTrusting ourselves and others‚ÄúYes And‚ÄùGiving and Receiving OffersSpatial and Physical Awareness/MimeCharacter WorkTeamworkReality & AuthenticityImprov scenes & gamesDates and Times:Monday evenings, 7:00pm-9:30pmSep 8, 15, 22, 29Oct 13, 20, 27Nov 3(Note: No class Oct 6)Course Fee:Earlybird*: $1,900 ($237.5/class, $95/hr)Regular: $3,000 ($375/class, $150/hr)*Earlybird pricing ends 18th AugustOur TBC Course Structure Explained:Our courses and classes have 2 defining numbers. The first number defines the level.100 series - Introductory200 series - Intermediate300 series - Advancedetc.Then the 01, 02, 03 etc. defines the type of class.101 Intro to Improv (building blocks) |102 Intro to Shortform |103 Intro to LongformWhat have our 101 students said about the series?" A part of me didn't want the 101 to finish. It was such great experience and it really helped me to explore the different area of my brain."" Thanks for the 101 it was so muchlies fun."" All are welcome, no previous improv experience required.Bring your own water bottle, there is no water available at the premises.Come ready to learn and hone your craft!

name: Introduction to Shortform Improv Course (102) - Fall Term
location: Fringe Club, 2 Lower Albert Road Underground Theatre Hong Kong, HKI
about: OverviewEver since the explosion of TV show "Who's Line is it Anyway?", the short-form style of improv (consisting of short scenes combining audience suggestions, improviser talents and pre-selected rules) has become synonymous with improv comedy. Though by no means the only style of improv, it is one that TBC Improv specialises in and this course will teach you the techniques behind it.Each class in the 8-week course will explore a particular genre of game: what games fall into the category, what skills they use and techniques for performing scenes within them. Become familiar with new games and reacquainted with old favourites!This course is ideally aimed at: those with some basic improv training and wishing to expand further; those who wish to specialise in short-form improv; performers with long-form background/experience wishing to become more relaxed and familiar with short-form improv.Class TopicsGeneral improv basics (refresher)Naive GamesCharacter & Scene GamesRestricted GamesMime & Physical GamesMusical & Rhyming GamesAudience Participation GamesThe Games List (or "How To Choose What To Play")Pre-requisite:Introduction to Improv (101) (or proof of equivalent)Dates and Times:Thursday evenings, 7:30-10:00pmSep 4, 11, 18, 25Oct 9, 16, 23, 30(Note: No class Oct 2)Our TBC Course Structure Explained:Our courses and classes have 2 defining numbers. about: ABOUT THE STORYStep into 17th-Century Versailles ‚Äì Through Virtual RealityExperience the forgotten heart of Versailles, where gardens once staged the grandeur of a rising empire.In this one-of-a-kind VR journey, guided by the legendary landscape architect Andr√© Le N√¥tre, you‚Äôll rediscover spaces imagined by Louis XIV as the pinnacle of royal art, power, and entertainment.ü¶Å The Royal Menagerie ‚Äì One of Europe‚Äôs earliest zoos, filled with exotic animals gifted by foreign rulers. It once symbolized royal power and global reach.üåÄ The Labyrinth Grove ‚Äì A fantastical garden built for the king‚Äôs son, filled with fountains and sculptures representing Aesop‚Äôs fables.üèõÔ∏è The Grotto of Tethys ‚Äì A breathtaking palace of water and light, once a symbol of royal power and artistic innovation.These gardens were designed as a living theatre ‚Äî an artistic and political stage to dazzle the court and reflect the king‚Äôs absolute power. Today, they are reborn through immersive technology.

name: Gajen Nad: Global Malaysian Chindian
location: BaseHall 2, 1 Connaught Place #15 LG/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: This show is part of the Hong Kong Comedy Season 2025In 2012, Gajen Nad took his first steps into stand-up comedy and event emceeing. After 6 years of balancing his passion with a corporate career, he made a bold move in 2018 to pursue comedy full-time.His dedication paid off when, last year, his comedy special, Professional Mixed Breed, premiered globally on Netflix, marking a major milestone as the first Penang-born comedian to achieve this.With over a decade of experience and over 1,000 events under his belt, he is known for his corporate-friendly and intelligent comedy suited for everyone!Here's what Gajen has to say about this show:"Listen, I mean read, here is my brand new 1-hour comedy special, Global Malaysian Chindian." This is a sequel to my previous special, Professional Mixed Breed, in 2022 (it's on Netflix!).In this show, I go deep into my roots and beginnings. From my Chindian childhood in the 90s, strict Indian family career expectations, engineering life, my Germany adventures, and...my niche toilet preferences.As always, the jokes are clean, culturally relatable, and perfect for locals and international friends alike! Bring your friends, dates, parents...even your ex. I promise it won‚Äôt be weird. See you soon!"This show is in English

name: Backstage Comedy Presents Elena Gabrielle Live! in Hong Kong
location: BaseHall 2, 1 Connaught Place #15 LG/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: This show is part of the Hong Kong Comedy Season 2025funny tales and unfiltered stories, Elena‚Äôs here to solve all your problems‚Äîor at least make you laugh about them! This time, she's going beyond her usual wild adventures to dive right into the audience. Yes, that means crowd work, so be ready to get involved! Elena‚Äôs blend of quick wit, hilarious storytelling, and no-holds-barred interactions will leave you wondering, ‚ÄúDid she just say that?‚Äù and maybe, ‚ÄúAm I next?‚Äù Come with questions, leave with laughs‚Äîand possibly a little scandal.About Elena Gabrielle:Elena Gabrielle‚Äôs satirical look on modern relationships teamed with her uproarious musicality has seen her stealthe show from Canada to South Africa. This Australian born European based comedian appeals to sold out audiences across the globe with her witty, no?holds barred approach to stand-up comedy and because of this, has seen her go viral with 40 million plus views on YouTube to date.Her embarrassing date stories are delivered in an intuitive storytelling style which cuts through cultural divides and is enjoyed globally. After touring non-stop for 3 years with ‚ÄòStory Party Tour‚Äô (which saw her perform over 700 shows in that time and in over 65 countries) and sold-out runs with her 2 solo tours ‚ÄúDIRRTY‚Äù in 2021/22 and ‚ÄúAddickted‚Äù in 2023, Elena is back on tour in 2024 with her new show ‚ÄúOK!?.In 2021 Elena was the face of two global ‚ÄúSwatch‚Äù advertising campaigns and her talents are greatly sought after across Europe, even opening for the US comedian and Netflix star Iliza Schlesinger.Multi-talented, she is trained in Musical Theatre at Australia‚Äôs prestigious and premier acting University NIDA (National Institute of Dramatic Art). Elena‚Äôs singing range is also impressive; from opera to rap, she weaves her passion for song into her comedy act with musical imitations from Celine Dion to Lady Gaga. She performed in The Shuffle Show‚Äô, an epic musical adventure of 1000 songs in 1 hour which sold out shows at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe and went on to appear on TEDx.Elena also holds a Guinness world record for producing and performing in Burleskathon, 24 hours of continuous Burlesque. Elena‚Äôs tongue-in-cheek and relatable comedy repertoire blended with her sublime singing voice and risque performances have worldwide audiences side-creased, exhilarated, and thoroughly entertained.This show is in English

name: UNHEARD 2025: BODY COUNT by Philipp Henkel
location: Tomorrow Maybe, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Kowloon Hong Kong, KOW
about: BODY COUNT is a visceral and provocative exploration of the human form as both a site of trauma and resilience. Through a fusion of  performance and mixed-media installation the piece interrogates the ways bodies are quantified, commodified, and politicized‚Äîwhether in war, healthcare, or systemic violence.Drawing from inspiration: forensic anthropology, memorial archives and  personal narratives, the work distorts and reconstructs the body, challenging viewers to confront the tension between individual identity and statistical anonymity. Fragmented, multiplied, or erased, the forms question: When does a body become a number? Who gets counted, and who remains invisible?With specific elements like repetitive silhouettes, raw data sonified and visualized, _Body Count_ oscillates between the intimate and the impersonal, urging a reckoning with the weight of collective loss and the fragility of corporeal existence.________Philipp Henkel is a German composer, curator, and multimedia artist based in Hannover. In his music, gestural instability and extended expressionism transform the subjective listening experience. His compositions and multimedia works explore the implications of technology and societal failure(s) through a research-led approach. In 2018 Henkel founded neuMERZ an interdisciplinary studio for research led art projects and curation in which he remains the artistic lead. Recent concerts and exhibitions of his work have taken place at GAIDA Festival in Lithuania, 21st Century Art Museum Kanazawa, Ryoguku Monten Hall Tokyo, Monopol Berlin, ZKM Karlsruhe.

name: UNHEARD 2025: Roberto Maqueda -All the times I couldn't' say goodbye...
location: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: All the times I couldn‚Äôt say goodbye‚Ä¶ is a deeply personal performance project by Roberto Maqueda that transforms unspoken farewells into sound. It explores the emotional landscape of relationships that faded without closure‚Äîthose moments suspended in silence and unresolved endings. Through four original compositions, the work navigates cycles of memory, doubt, and longing, while ultimately offering a fragile sense of hope. Premiered in Z√ºrich in 2025, the piece is an attempt to sonify the unsaid and give voice to what was left behind.

name: UNHEARD 2025: Channelling Reduction by Simon Whetham
location: Tomorrow Maybe, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Kowloon Hong Kong, KOW
about: ‚ÄúChannelling‚Äù is a kinetic audiovisual project, in which a collection of motor devices salvaged from obsolete and discarded consumer technology is reanimated by environmental sound recordings. In turn, this produces new sounds from the devices, which are amplifed using various microphones and techniques.The recordings feature seemingly mundane sound phenomena that occur unpredictably and irregularly in everyday life ‚Äì passing traffic, wind, doors closing ‚Äì and also sounds of other machines malfunctioning. Because of this, the movement of the devices is random, variable, and autonomous. This means the relationship between performer and devices is a collaboration rather than a master and servant type situation.‚ÄúChannelling Reduction‚Äù follows the trend of technology to miniaturise as it evolves, becoming smaller and lighter, but more powerful.Simon Whetham:Since 2005 Simon Whetham has worked with sonic activity as a material. He often uses environmental sound, employing a variety of methods and techniques in order to obtain often unnoticed and obscured sonic phenomena. He also explores ways of creating physical traces of sound and transforming energy forms.Whetham performs and exhibits internationally, has received a large number of commissions and awards, has many published composed works and regularly collaborates with other artists. His practice also covers giving active listening, field recording and technology repurposing workshops.

name: 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair
location: Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre, 1  Expo Drive Wan Chai, HKI
about: Welcome to the 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair!Meet over 50 leading law firms, professional legal organisations and law schools in Hong Kong - all gathered under one roof to offer you insights, guidance, and opportunities to connect with the legal profession.This is your chance to ask questions, explore career paths, and build networks that matter.Free admission is offered to penultimate LLB, double law degree and JD students. Law students from other years are also welcome to register for free admission, but is subject to availability.Non-law and LLM students are welcome to attend with a registration fee of HKD 500, and admission is subject to a quota.Registration is required to attend, and successful registrants will receive a QR code before the event.We look forward to seeing you at Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre!*In the event of adverse weather conditions (e.g. T8 or above, or a Black Rainstorm Signal), the Law Fair Committee will consider rescheduling the event to Sunday, 7 September 2025, subject to venue availability. Further details will be announced if this occurs.
